text: The is a museum of the history of Tokyo during he Edo period.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Museums" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 671-673. It was established in 1993. The permanent exhibition includes a replica of the Nihonbashi and scale models of the city. The museum was designed by Kiyonori Kikutake.Kiyonori Kikutake Architects . Retrieved 30 July 2011 The Edo-Tokyo Open Air Architectural Museum is a branch of the Edo-Tokyo Museum. ==Gallery== File:Matsudaira residence Edo P3.jpg|Looking down at architectural model of an Edo period residence File:Edo-tokyo Museum.JPG|Looking at model showing an Edo period street scene File:Tokyo 2016 Edo-Tokyo Museum.jpg|Banners promoting the Tokyo bid to host the 2016 Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * Edo- Tokyo Museum website Category:1993 establishments in Japan Category:Museums in Tokyo
title: Edo-Tokyo Museum
